content.description: This route starts low by the tree and climbs the steep face by the tree.  The tree is in the way right now but some webbing to tie it back or a hedge clipping will get it ready to go.
content.location: Left of main slab rock on a steep face.

content.description: Sit start left of the tree by the minature slab and climb straight up the bulge/blunt arete on finger buckets.
content.protection: Pads and spotters.  There are some rocks in the landing, but a pad to cover them and a pad to even the surface will do the trick.
content.location: The route is on a block left of the main slab rock on a steep face

content.description: This is the red route on the beta photo.  Traverse right using a thin finger rail.
content.location: Heading uphill, this is one of the last main boulder passed the Loner Stone Boulder about 100 feet down from a large parking area.  It is visible from the road.

content.description: This is the teal route on the beta photo.  Sit start on a good flakes and trend left, laying back and finding the best jugs.
content.location: Heading uphill, this is one of the last main boulder passed the Loner Stone Boulder about 100 feet down from a large parking area.  It is visible from the road.

content.description: This is the blue route on the beta photo. Layback the right-trending seam.  Huge jugs on the upper flake help with the topout.
content.location: This is on one of the last main boulders heading uphill past Loner Stone about 100 feet down from a large parking area.  It is visible from the road.

content.description: Climb the broken dihedral at the center of the boulder.  This is the pink line in the beta photo.
content.location: Heading uphill, it is past the Loner Stone Boulder and only 100 feet from a large parking area. It is visible from the road.
